TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 2015. 12. 20. at 9:03 PM, Yakky said:
> 
> 
> a user named **Phredd Pewter** sent a giant cow named Bessie to the Mun.
> 

I feel the need to repost -that- here... Mainly to find it the next time I go trough this thread after I forget again how awesome are the stuff in there..

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/uh45c/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>
![8oTYii4.png](http://i.imgur.com/8oTYii4.png)

Not mine.. but the sheer desperation demonstrated in this shot gets me every time.. part of my KSP rotating wallpaper collection.

![Needs%20moar%20boosters_zpsnauc5t9w.png~](http://i407.photobucket.com/albums/pp159/ElYoda69/Needs%20moar%20boosters_zpsnauc5t9w.png~original)

> 
> 
> 14 hours ago, KerBlammo said:
> 
> 
> [![8oTYii4.png](http://i.imgur.com/8oTYii4.png)](http://i.imgur.com/8oTYii4.png "Enlarge image")
> 

There's nothing funny about success, sir. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

During a routine landing test of a tail-sitting Mun plane on the runway in 0.90, I discovered that on Kerbin, even long strips of concrete are built using a surprising amount of TNT. Only time I've truly guffawed in KSP, and I was lucky enough to reach F12 before the moment passed. I believe the craft escaped the blast intact.

Spoiler

Spoiler

![wYNCjc4.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/wYNCjc4.jpg)

![2sedWHz.png](http://i.imgur.com/2sedWHz.png)

Turning my  'one of every stock part' rocket upside down. Mirbeth, who has the BadS trait can't help but look a little worried.

"Mission Control, this is Jeb; am I cleared to land? Over."  

"Uh, negatory, Jeb; there is some, uh, debris on the runway. Advise staying in holding pattern for, uh, a while. Over."

![SaM57kx.png](http://i.imgur.com/SaM57kx.png)

Here's another one with quite a wacky story. I had a Kontract to build a station supporting 20 kerbals around Minimus, and I really didn't want to do it, but I also REALLY didn't want to decline the contract. Once I completed the contract, I decided to land it. Because, why not?

Patcan Kerman performing a 3.2km/s interplanetary aerobrake while riding an asteroid captured by the Buran 11F35 Kerbal 1.

![knLo23p.png](http://i.imgur.com/knLo23p.png)

Surprisingly didn't die on the interplanetary aero-brake, but "exploded due to overheating" on the second re-entry!

SM

this photo shows how lucky i am,i landed a airplane because i was low on fuel,it braked well,but at 20 ms it flipped,just the crew cabin snapped,no boom,just a little separation... now i have to do the trip again.....

![GjOXcxT.png](http://i.imgur.com/GjOXcxT.png)

and these ones is what i did in a desperate attempt to fullfil a flyby under the R&D bridge contract,the first one looks a lot like a rocket,but its much smaller..

![aYFFYLw.png](http://i.imgur.com/aYFFYLw.png)

![OIK31Ad.png](http://i.imgur.com/OIK31Ad.png)

however.i cant do it...so my next project is a fuel tank with wings,a jet engine and a chair,for jebediah...
